content.introduction: Using 'sizeof' for array given as function argument returns the size of a pointer. It does not return the size of the whole array in bytes as might be expected. For example, this code:\012     int f(char a[100]) {\012         return sizeof(a);\012     }\012returns 4 (in 32-bit systems) or 8 (in 64-bit systems) instead of 100 (the size of the array in bytes).
